medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The lesions were first noticed at 3 months of age when the infant was exclusively breastfed. At 15 months, total cholesterol was 675 mg/dL and LDL-C was 540 mg/dL. After introducing a low-fat/low-cholesterol diet and cholestyramine therapy at 16 months, cholesterol levels decreased dramatically and normalized within 2 months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was diagnosed with sitosterolemia due to compound heterozygous mutations in ABCG5.
medical_history.family_history: There was no family history of dyslipidemia or premature cardiovascular disease; however, the patient's 5-year-old sister had total cholesterol of 284 mg/dL and LDL-C of 210 mg/dL.
